patternTriggers: Power of 2? Use n & (n-1) == 0. Power of 2 has exactly ONE set bit.

approaches.name: Count Set Bits - Brute Force
approaches.intuition: Power of 2 has exactly one set bit. Count set bits, if count is 1 and n > 0, it's power of 2.
approaches.approach: Count all set bits, check if exactly one.

complexity.timeExplanation: Iterate through all bits, at most 32 iterations

approaches.name: Repeated Division by 2
approaches.intuition: If n is power of 2, we can keep dividing by 2 until we reach 1. If any remainder, it's not power of 2.

approaches.name: Bit Manipulation - Optimal
approaches.intuition: Power of 2 has exactly ONE set bit. n & (n-1) removes rightmost set bit. If result is 0, there was only one set bit.

hints: Power of 2 has exactly ONE set bit in binary
Use n & (n-1) to remove rightmost set bit
If result is 0, only one bit was set
